revised_title: Improving Atomic and Molecular Wave-Function Calculations with Configuration Interaction
tldr: The authors present a method for improving wave-function calculations in atomic and molecular physics by using configuration interaction. They develop a systematic approach to estimate corrections for configuration interaction in wave-function calculations, simplifying the matrix of the many-particle Hamiltonian. This method can be applied to both electronic and nuclear systems, offering a more accurate approximation to an exact wave function.
